FuncDef:
The session-group-exclude command excludes the service traffic of users going online from a specified domain from the family policy scheduling.
Using undo session-group-exclude command clears the current configuration and restore the default configuration.
By default, service traffic of users participates in the family policy scheduling.
CLIs: undo session-group-exclude [ car | user-queue ] { inbound | outbound }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that service traffic of users in a specified domain is excluded from the CAR scheduling of the family policy.
-

Indicates that service traffic of users in a specified domain is excluded from the SQ scheduling of the family policy.
-

Excludes the incoming service traffic of users from the family policy scheduling.
-

Excludes the outgoing service traffic of users from the family policy scheduling.
-

ExtraInfo:
The session-group-exclude car command excludes service traffic of users of a specified domain from CAR scheduling of the family policy.
The session-group-exclude user-queue command excludes service traffic of users of a specified domain from SQ scheduling of the family policy.
